product_overview: Chame Alfredo is a full-stack service orchestration platform designed for technical assistance and maintenance companies. It centralizes scheduling, service orders, inventory, and field operations management in a single web and mobile web environment, using real-time data synchronization via Supabase.
core_goals: Reduce scheduling and technician allocation time.
Minimize operational errors such as address, time, and inventory mistakes.
Increase on-time completion rate of service orders.
Enhance real-time visibility of operations including schedules, status, and inventory.
Lay foundation for future SaaS multi-tenant offering with billing integration.
key_features: Operational Command Center Dashboard with calendar view (day/week/month) for technician schedule management.
Service order listing with status tracking (pending, en route, executing, completed, cancelled).
Service order assignment and reassignment interface to technicians.
Filtering options by technician, order status, service type, and period.
High-density inventory management table with critical stock alerts and search/filter capabilities.
Mobile web app for technicians providing offline-first access to schedules and service details.
Service order status progression and digital client signature capture in mobile app.
Automatic company data filling via CNPJ integration for faster and error-free registration.
Automatic budget calculation based on estimated time, selected materials, and configurable price tables.
Authentication system with multi-role support (Admin, Technician, Client) integrated with Supabase Auth.
user_flow_summary: Service Order Creation: Backoffice users create clients and service orders with auto-filled company data via CNPJ, triggering automatic budget calculation and adding orders as 'Pending'.
Schedule and Allocation: Operations coordinators manage and assign service orders in the Command Center dashboard using filters and calendar views.

Field Execution by Technician: Technicians access the mobile web app to view their assigned orders, update status during the workflow, record material usage, collect client digital signatures, and mark orders completed.
Closure and Reporting: Updated service order statuses are reflected on the dashboard, preparing data for future export and financial integration.
validation_criteria: Dashboard loads within 3-4 seconds under average data loads.
Realtime synchronization via Supabase updates orders and inventory with minimal delays.
Authentication and authorization correctly enforce role-based access and data isolation via Supabase RLS.
Critical stock alerts appear accurately when inventory falls below minimum levels.
Offline-first functionality syncs technician updates when connectivity is restored.
Automatic CNPJ data filling populates company details correctly.
Budget calculations correctly factor time, materials, and pricing tables.
Filters in dashboard return accurate results and support multiple criteria.
Mobile app captures and stores digital signatures securely.
User interface follows Tailwind CSS patterns and supports high-density data presentation effectively.
